Scholarship_Name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
A full tuition fee waiver from the host institution for the scholarship year.
A monthly stipend of €10,000 (total for the year) directed at supporting student costs and living expenses.
Important Note: While the scholarship provides substantial financial aid, applicants are advised to ensure they have sufficient additional funding or personal savings to cover any remaining costs while studying in Ireland.
Eligible_Applicants: Open to outstanding non-EU/EEA students (citizens of countries other than the United Kingdom, Switzerland, the European Union, or the European Economic Area). Applicants must not have previously held a GOI-IES scholarship. Must have a conditional or final offer of admission to an eligible Irish higher education institution for a full-time, international, fee-paying postgraduate programme of at least one year's duration (NFQ levels 9 or 10).
Eligible_Fields: Master’s, Postgraduate Diploma, PhD programmes (NFQ levels 9 or 10). No specific field-of-study restrictions beyond the specified postgraduate levels.
Career_Plan: Expected to be detailed within the personal statement, outlining future aspirations.
Other_Requirements: Applicants are expected to demonstrate strong motivation for studying in Ireland and familiarity with Irish culture, way of life, or the academic importance of their chosen field in Ireland (key component of personal statement). Must be a full-time, international, fee-paying student.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) is a prestigious initiative funded by the Government of Ireland in partnership with Irish higher education institutions (HEIs) and managed by the Irish Higher Education Authority (HEA). The primary goal of this program is to attract high-calibre international students from non-EU/EEA countries to pursue postgraduate studies in Ireland. The scholarship supports study across various disciplines at eligible Irish higher education institutions.
Application_Documents:
Academic Transcripts
Recommendation Letters (refer to "Guidance for Referees")
Personal Statement (addressing academic achievements, work experience, motivation for studying in Ireland, and familiarity with Irish culture/academic importance)
Passport (copy)
Offer Letter from an eligible Irish HEI (must confirm eligibility for GOI-IES, i.e., full-time, international, fee-paying postgraduate for at least one year)
Marksheet
Official Program Documents: GOI-IES Call Document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, Application Help Document (all available on the HEA website).
Timeline:
Call for Applications for 2025/2026 academic year : Officially open
2025-03-05 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship typically offers a monthly stipend ranging from 900 to 1000 euros. For a 9-month scholarship, this translates to an annual grant of approximately 8,100 to 9,000 euros.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition Fees: Full coverage of tuition fees for the chosen program.
*   Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance coverage.
*   Monthly Stipend: A monthly allowance to cover living expenses.
Eligible_Applicants: Applicants must be foreign students not residing in Italy or Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Italian residents are explicitly not eligible for this scholarship. Applicants must hold an appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in their chosen Italian University or Institute. Applicants cannot hold another Italian government scholarship concurrently.
Eligible_Fields:
Bachelor's Degree programs
Master's Degree programs
PhD programs
Higher Education for Fine Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programs
Research under academic supervision
Specialization and Vocational Schools
Advanced Italian language and culture courses
Disciplines: science, art, economics, engineering, culture
Language_Certificate: Italian A2 (CEFR), Italian B2 (CEFR), IELTS, TOEFL
Age: Varies by program: Under 23 for Bachelor's, Under 28 for Master's/AFAM/Language, Under 30 for PhD
Special_Circumstances: Applicants cannot hold another Italian government scholarship concurrently.
Career_Plan: A detailed motivation letter or essay explaining the applicant's career goals and how the scholarship and studying in Italy will contribute to achieving them.
Other_Requirements:
Two reference letters from teachers or professors are typically required.
A portfolio, if requested for specific programs (e.g., AFAM).
A summary of the research project for PhD or research under academic supervision programs.
Personal criteria, including motivation and overall suitability for the program and cultural exchange.
Scholarship_Info: The Italian Government Scholarship, officially known as MAECI Grants, is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program offered by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI). Designed to foster international cultural and scientific cooperation, promote the Italian language and higher education system, and facilitate cultural exchange, these scholarships enable foreign students not residing in Italy and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE) to pursue various academic programs in Italy.
Application_Documents:
Online application form
Motivation letter/essay
Reference letters
Research project summary (for research/PhD programs)
Academic achievements and transcripts
Portfolio (if requested for specific programs)
Timeline:
Prior to May 16, 2025 : Call for applications open for 2025-2026 academic year
May 16, 2025, 2:00 PM (Italian time) : Application Deadline
November 1, 2025 - July 31, 2026 : 9-month scholarships typically awarded
January 1 - September 30, 2026 : 3-month scholarships typically running
2025-2026 : Academic Year

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend, Other Costs, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
Overall Funding: Up to 58,800 RMB annually for undergraduate and graduate programs.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition: Covered for some programs, notably at Nankai University.
*   Dormitory: Covered for some programs, notably at Nankai University.
*   Stipend:
    *   Master's programs: CNY 1,700/month.
    *   General: Up to CNY 2,000/month.
    *   Nankai University: CNY 3,000-3,500/month.
*   Comprehensive Insurance: CNY 800/year.
*   One-Time Allowance: CNY 800 for new students.
Specific Award Levels: Some sources indicate a scholarship amount of CNY 10,000 for Master's and Doctoral degrees, and an award rate of RMB 2,000 per person per year for academic excellence (Nankai University). These amounts may represent specific award levels, partial funding, or awards for outstanding students rather than the full scholarship package.
Quantity: Substantial number, e.g., 178 nominees for Tianjin University in 2020.
Eligible_Applicants: Non-Chinese citizens in good mental and physical health, demonstrating academic excellence. Open to self-funded international students (prospective and current) applying for undergraduate, master's, or doctoral programs at participating universities. No specific country restrictions are mentioned.
Eligible_Fields:
Fields aligned with Tianjin's local development goals
Chemical Engineering (Master's at Tianjin University)
Other_Requirements: Applicants must be in good mental and physical health. Applicants are expected to demonstrate academic excellence. Personal statements should use clear and concise language. All documents must be in English or Chinese. Applicants must meet the specific language requirements of their chosen higher education institution and provide relevant proofs. Applicants must first pass the international student review at their chosen university and secure pre-admission to be eligible for nomination.
Scholarship_Info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship is a prestigious award provided by the Tianjin Government in China. It aims to attract talented international students from around the world to pursue higher education in Tianjin, one of China's largest and most rapidly developing cities. The scholarship offers an outstanding opportunity for recipients to receive an internationally recognized education and immerse themselves in China's rich culture and academic excellence.
Application_Documents:
Required Documents:
*   Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form (online registration or downloadable form)
*   Application Form for Foreigners Wishing to Study at Tianjin University
*   Admission Letter (or pre-admission letter from the university)
*   Application Form for Visa to China for Overseas Students (JW202 or JW201)
*   Physical Examination Report and Test Report (Original Copy)
*   Passport (with a validity period of six months or more)
*   Original No Crime Certificate
*   HSK/English Proficiency Certificates (as applicable)
*   Notarized academic transcript in Chinese and English
*   Two Recommendation Letters (from two different referrers, required for Master's or PhD applicants)
*   Study and Work Experience Resume (since High School to present, must show uninterrupted start and end times and clear education levels)
*   For Nankai University: Online application for international students via their admission system and payment of the application fee.
Timeline:
December - June (following academic year) : General Application Period
December 1, 2024 : Application Opening Date (for Nankai University 2025 intake)
February 15, 2025 : Application Deadline (Nankai University for 2025 intake)
May 31, 2025 : Application Deadline (General)
June 20, 2025 : Application Deadline (General)
June 30, 2025 : Application Deadline (Tianjin Normal University)
July 1 - August 31 : Admission results announced on university websites (e.g., Tianjin University)
Following admission results : Assessment results publicized for one week
Following assessment results : Nominated list submitted to Tianjin Municipal Education Commission
Following submission : Final scholarship list determined by experts
Scholarship Duration: One year, renewable annually
Target Intakes: 2025 and 2026 intakes

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Full tuition coverage for the chosen program.
Monthly stipends equivalent to three Colombian legal monthly minimum wages.
Health insurance and medical costs.
Installation expenses upon arrival in Colombia.
A one-time grant for the issuance of a foreign identification card.
Expenses for books and materials, granted for each year of study.
Visa expenses.
General living expenses.
Quantity: 81 scholarships were granted in 2024. The exact number of awards for the 2025-2026 academic year has not been specified.
Eligible_Applicants: Must be an international student/foreign citizen, not having Colombian nationality or dual nationality (Colombian). Must not be residing or have started postgraduate studies in Colombia, nor have resided in Colombia for the last 6 months prior to applying. Not a previous beneficiary of ICETEX through the Beca Colombia program. Must possess a professional or bachelor's degree and be admitted to at least one eligible postgraduate program at a participating Colombian higher education institution. Minimum cumulative undergraduate GPA equivalent to 4.0 out of 5.0 on the Colombian scale. At least one year of professional experience relevant to the chosen field of study. Must demonstrate proficiency in Spanish. High-achieving international students with exceptional academic merit and leadership potential are sought. Open to citizens of all countries.
Eligible_Fields:
Postgraduate Degrees: Master’s, Ph.D., Specialization
Priority Areas: Scientific research, Technology, Innovation
Other_Requirements: A recent academic letter of reference from a university professor who oversaw the applicant's bachelor's degree is required. Additional letters of recommendation may be requested if deemed necessary by the program or institution.
Scholarship_Info: The Colombia Government Scholarship (Beca Colombia Scholarship Programme for Foreigners) is a prestigious fully funded opportunity for international students wishing to pursue postgraduate studies (Master's, Ph.D., and Specialization degrees) in Colombia. Coordinated by ICETEX, it is a key component of Colombia’s Reciprocity Programme, fostering academic, cultural, and technological exchange.
Application_Documents:
Verified copies of educational transcripts/university certificates (in English or Spanish) certifying the applicant's average grade point in their bachelor's degree.
Professional Experience Certificate(s) demonstrating at least one year of relevant experience.
A recent academic letter of reference.
A document confirming that the applicant has not been residing in Colombia prior to applying.
Proof of admission to at least one eligible postgraduate program at a Colombian higher education institution.
Timeline:
May 28, 2025 : Application Opening Date
June 24, 2025 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship generally amounts to €10,000 for the academic year (e.g., 2024-2025 and 2025-2026 cycles).
Some sources specify a €10,020 grant and a tuition waiver.
This typically includes an annual grant of €10,000 to cover living expenses and study costs.
An alternative reported award amount is €8,400 plus a year's worth of tuition fees.
The scholarship lasts one year for a 60 ECTS program or two years for a 120 ECTS program.
It cannot be combined with other scholarships.
Quantity: Globally: up to 45 (30 for 2026 cycle), American students: 5
Eligible_Applicants: International students from all countries. Must apply to and be accepted by a Master's degree program at a Flemish higher education institution. Previous degree cannot be from a Flemish institution. Students already enrolled in a Flemish institution are not eligible, except for those on credit mobility (e.g., Erasmus+).
Eligible_Fields:
Humanities and Social Sciences
Science
Engineering
Language_Certificate: IELTS 7.0, Cambridge CPE C2, TOEFL 94, CEFR C1
Special_Circumstances: 5 scholarships are reserved exclusively for American students.
Other_Requirements: Two letters of reference. Host institution performs academic check. For VUB, official letter of acceptance from Education and Student Administration Office is needed before applying.
Scholarship_Info: The Master Mind Scholarship is a prestigious program offered by the Government of Flanders, designed to attract outstanding international students to pursue Master's degree programs in Flanders and Brussels, Belgium.
Application_Documents:
Curriculum Vitae (CV), including American GPA (out of 4.0), publications, academic awards, and previous scholarships (if applicable).
Passport photograph.
National ID or passport.
Transcripts/records of previous academic performance.
Letter of motivation.
Two reference letters.
KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (as an annex for KU Leuven applicants).
Official letter of acceptance issued by the Education and Student Administration Office (VUB specific).
Bank details (name, BIC/SWIFT, IBAN/bank account number, name of account holder).
Timeline:
October/November (depending on cycle) : Application Start (general)
15 October 2025 : Applications open for 2026-2027 cycle
December 2025 : UAntwerp next call
1 February 2025 : UAntwerp application deadline for 2025-2026 (now closed)
27 April 2025 : Application deadline for 2025 cycle
15 January 2026, 23:59 CET : Application deadline for 2026-2027 cycle (KU Leuven & general)
15 March 2026, 23:59 GMT+1 : Application deadline for 2026 cycle
Application Process Steps:
1. Student applies for admission to an eligible Master’s program at a Flemish host institution.
2. Student is preselected by the Master's program coordinator at the host institution.
3. Host institution starts the application procedure for the Master Mind scholarship by creating the candidate’s application file in the Mobility-Online tool.
4. Preselected students receive an email generated by the Mobility-Online tool (Invitation to Apply).
5. Master's programs nominate eligible students who have expressed interest in the scholarship (follows application deadline).
6. The International Relations Office of the university screens all files and submits a shortlist to the Flemish Government.
7. Shortlisted students are contacted by the university’s International Office with necessary information to complete their online Master Mind scholarship application in the Mobility Online tool.
8. The Flemish Government makes the final decision on scholarship recipients.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully Funded Scholarships, providing 100% tuition coverage, full funding with stipends, and comprehensive coverage for travel, accommodation, and subsistence expenses.
Covered Expenses:
- Tuition fees
- Monthly living allowances
- Research funding
- Stipends
- Travel expenses (implied international travel)
- Accommodation
- Subsistence expenses
- Specific Accommodation Allowance: 7,000–9,000 Baht/month (depending on location).
Eligible_Applicants: International students from developing countries/partners, not Thai citizens. Must be nominated by the National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation or relevant central government agencies in an eligible country/territory. Applicants should be working in the government sector or in areas related to the course provided. Civil servants must fulfill BCSR 2023 criteria; applicants outside civil service (Corporate, Private Sector, NGO, etc.) must fulfill Department of Workforce Planning and Skills Development, MoESD criteria. Scholarships are allocated for specific member states/eligible countries/territories. Relevant Governmental Agencies of OIC Member States (and other eligible countries/territories) are requested to nominate up to five (5) candidates per course. Candidates must generally be no more than 45 years of age. Must be in good physical and mental condition and not pregnant.
Eligible_Fields:
Master's Degree programs in areas such as:
Sufficiency Economy Philosophy (SEP)
Climate Change and Environmental Issues
Agriculture and Food Security
Public Health
Bio-Circular-Green Economy Model (BCG)
Other topics related to Sustainable Development Goals.
Specific Examples of Programs: Master of Science in Occupational and Environmental Health, Master of Primary Health Care Management (International program), Master of Science Program in Parasitology (International Program), Master of Science Program in Tropical Medicine (International Program), Master of Science Program in Science (International Program).
Special_Circumstances: Candidates must be in good physical and mental condition and must not be pregnant.
Career_Plan: Applicants are strongly advised to clearly define their short-term and long-term goals, being specific about what they want to achieve and how they plan to get there. This is often a component of the application essay.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must meet relevant qualification requirements and demonstrate relevant current work experience. Recommendation letters from at least two persons (one person per letter), typically from a university or professional supervisor.
Scholarship_Info: The Thailand International Postgraduate Programme (TIPP) is a flagship scholarship initiative of the Royal Thai Government, introduced in 2000. It provides fully funded Master's degree opportunities for international students from developing partner countries, fostering international cooperation, sustainable development, and cultural exchange. It is an annual program with approximately 24 participating universities.
Application_Documents:
- TIPP application form (downloadable from the TICA website).
- Online application form (links provided annually, e.g., for TIPP 2025).
- English test score (if required by the academic institution).
- Recommendation letters (at least two).
- Other documents as required by the specific academic institution and the scholarship guidelines.
Timeline:
Annually : Applications typically open
2025-01-31 : Application Deadline for TIPP 2024 courses (for 2025 intake)
Ongoing : TICA lists courses for TIPP spanning from 2019 up to 2028
Application Process:
1. Candidates fill in the online application form on the TICA website.
2. Candidates must be nominated by their National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation or relevant central government agencies.
3. The National Focal Point forwards the nominated candidates’ documents to the Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission/Consulate.
4. Application is complete when TICA receives hard copy documents through diplomatic channels.
